thread.title: Who is the bride brave enough to invite Megan Markle to her wedding? Meet the Hon Lara Hughes-Young
thread.title_full: Who is the bride brave enough to invite Megan Markle to her wedding? Meet the Hon Lara Hughes-Young

author: Lucy Buckland
title: Who is the bride brave enough to invite Megan Markle to her wedding? Meet the Hon Lara Hughes-Young
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
You would have to be very brave or very self assured to invite Meghan Markle to your wedding. 
As the first formal event the pair have attended together, the world's eyes were focused on the wedding of the Hon Lara Hughes-Young to long-term fiance 'Skippy' Inskip at Hopewell Baptist Church in Montego Bay. 
Knowing her dress and Meghan's would be beamed around the world must have been a daunting thought for Lara (as it would be for any bride) - but it appears the self-assured developer threw caution to the wind and allowed Harry to bring his date. Lara grins as she leaves the church as a married woman (Photo: MEGA) Lara and Skippy are known on the party circuit (Photo: WireImage) Lara is thought to be "fantastically funny" (Photo: WireImage) 
And Lara's wedding gown didn't disappoint, with breathtaking simplicity, the white satin gown with plunge back and neck was a direct contrast to Megan's high necked Erdem gown, making sure all the attention was on the bride. 
But just who is Lara? And how does she know the prince? 
Newlywed Lara, who is a Developer at ThoughtWorks, met the Prince through her now husband Skippy who went to Eton with Harry. 
Lara is the granddaughter of the late Conservative MP Michael Hughes-Young, who was made Baron St Helens, and her father now holds the title Lord St Helens. Read More
